title: I'm being sued by 3rd party debt collector. I missed my case management hearing, now I'm facing OSC-Non Sanctions. What is that?
question: A 3rd party debt collector is suing my for $1,500.00. I submitted an answer and responded to their discovery items, I am in the process of preparing mine. I am doing all of this on my own, (I can't afford them to win by default and I cannot afford an attorney). The court scheduled a case management hearing for last Friday and I submitted my case management statement but was unable to make it to the hearing. Now it's been rescheduled and there is also "OSC-Non Sanctions" scheduled as well. I am trying to find out what this means. I feel so helpless, I don't know what I am doing and am so overwhelmed with all of this. I don't have it in me to continue fighting this and don't know what to do next, I know they don't have a contract and am trying to request by the discovery process that so I can get this dismissed. I just feel extremely intimidated by these attorneys and the courts and as I said, helpless. Is there any advice anyone can give me, and can someone please just explain what may happen when I go to the case management hearing. Thank you in advance.
answers: May I suggest you contact the San Diego Legal Aid Society. If you qualify, you can obtain legal representation. 877 534-2524

I agree with the above answer and if you are overwhelmed I think you should look for an attorney in your area who knows how to deal with debt buyers. There are more than a few near Oceanside. You may have a case against the debt buyer and / or debt collectors involved.

Outside of that you might consider whether you have other debt and whether this may be only the beginning of these types of lawsuits; you may want a more permanent solution to fighting them off as they come after you.
show up at the hearing; apologize and say you will not miss another hearing.

On the one hand $1,500 is not all that much debt, but perhaps this is just the tip of a debt iceberg. Have you spoken with a Bankruptcy Attorney? Your assets, debts, income and expenses will be the most important facts (in general) for evaluating a potential bankruptcy filing. Perhaps a Fresh Start through bankruptcy fits your facts and goals.
